fields.headline: Jones has Wolves behind him
fields.bodyText: The Wolves manager Dave Jones must be feeling the pressure after six defeats in eight games, especially after getting what sounded suspiciously like a vote of confidence yesterday. "Like the fans we are bitterly disappointed with the last six or seven games," said Jez Moxey, the club's chief executive. "But we have every confidence in the management team and players to turn it around." After the worst run of his 21 months at Molineux, Jones may have only 10 days to effect an improvement - until the next game, a televised tea-time encounter at Stoke on Saturday week. "These two weeks have to be two weeks of intense hard work, reflection and addressing of the issues," Moxey said. "The Stoke game is a great opportunity to start the process of rebuilding confidence that is clearly lacking. "That game is the start of a new 35-game season for us. A good performance live on TV can re-ignite our campaign." Moxey looked forward to the return of Mark Kennedy and Colin Cameron from injury for the Stoke game but suggested that Wolves had been missing more than just a couple of midfielders. "We have to cut out the errors and start rebuilding confidence," he said, "and everyone here is trying to do that." Wolves, who spent most of last season in second place before being edged out by their neighbours West Brom and then losing out to Norwich in the play-off semi-final, are 17 points behind the First Division leaders Portsmouth. "It's important to get back to winning ways and we haven't got to be looking too far ahead," added the chief executive. "What we have to is address the issues we are facing. "We have all the ingredients here to be successful. We need to stick together on and off the field and hopefully get a break here and there."
